title: Print, 1578
provenance: 1942: acquired by Museum (from P. and D. Colnaghi and Co., Ltd.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Circular; a representation of Charity in the central medallion. Representations of works of charity outside: Christ washing the feet of the disciples. Care of the wounded and sick; alms; Cimon chained and suckled by his daughter. Distribution of food to the poor. Inscriptions in French and Low German.

participants.person_name: P. and D. Colnaghi and Co., Ltd.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, 1578. Engraving on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1942-36-7.
